But eight world mountain west states are among the ten us states with the highest suicide rates NPR's Kirk Siegler visited one town Grand Junction Colorado which is trying to do something about it
At the confluence of the Gunnison and Colorado rivers Grand Junction sits in a bowl of a valley ringed by tall mountains desert bases and red rock cliffs you can see how someone who is struggling could feel a little trapped here this is how Seventeen year old Victoria Mendoza describes it
And we can't really fix this because this nature but the surrounding now and I feel like the people in our valley feel like there's only life in Grand junction
Mendoza has battled with depression runs in her family the first funeral she ever went to was a little girl was for an uncle who died by suicide
Things got really hard a couple of years ago when there was a rash of teen suicides seven over a school year one was a student Mendoza knew from being in band together at another high school student killed himself in the parking lot in front of a crowd honestly
At another high school student killed himself in the parking lot in front of a crowd
Honestly physically kind of felt like there was like this cloud around her whole valley we were just kind of anticipating the next one and it got to a point where we were just like waiting for the next one

Regardless of the causes evil says that after those teen suicides of twenty sixteen and Seventeen the school district was forced to act the old way wasn't working
Victoria Mendoza says at first kids were told not to talk about the suicides or publicly memorialize the victims the thinking was that there would be copycats or students might not get good advice if they talk to adults who weren't trained and that was frustrating for Mendoza
And it kind of just made a division between all of us because we were all scared to even say anything about it
Fast forward to today and things appear to be changing Mendoza who's now a senior is one of dozens of peer mentor
Mendoza who's now a senior is one of dozens of pure mentors and the districts news sources of strength suicide prevention program and she's trained to be a gatekeeper to recognize when fellow students could be in trouble

And also that she may be able to recognize someone who is struggling earlier on and connect them to help
A lot of this came from the students who demanded action
